intro: Sageretia thea var. thea, commonly known as the Chinese angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is native to regions of East Asia.
